title: Mad Libs Game

steps.title: Collect story ingredients
steps.instruction: Create variables for different types of words: a noun, a verb, an adjective, and a place.
steps.hint: In real Python, you'd use input() to get these from the user. For now, just assign string values.
steps.code:
# Collect words for the story
noun = "dragon"
verb = "dancing"
adjective = "sparkly"
place = "library"

steps.title: Create the story template
steps.instruction: Write a story using f-strings that inserts the variables you created.
steps.hint: Use f"{variable}" to insert variables into your story. Make it funny!
steps.code:
# Create the story
story = f"""Once upon a time, there was a {adjective} {noun}.
Every day, it would go to the {place} for {verb}.
Everyone thought this was very unusual!"""

print(story)

steps.title: Make it interactive
steps.instruction: Add more words and make your story longer and sillier!
steps.hint: Try adding: an animal, a food, a number, a color, etc.
steps.code:
# Extended Mad Libs
animal = "penguin"
food = "pizza"
number = "42"
color = "purple"

story = f"""The {color} {animal} loved {food}.
One day, it met a {adjective} {noun} at the {place}.
They spent {number} hours {verb} together.
It was the best day ever!"""

print(story)

solution:
# Mad Libs Game - Complete Solution

# Collect words for the story
noun = "dragon"
verb = "dancing"
adjective = "sparkly"
place = "library"
animal = "penguin"
food = "pizza"
number = "42"
color = "purple"

# Create the story
story = f"""=== THE AMAZING ADVENTURE ===

Once upon a time, there was a {adjective} {noun}.
Every day, it would go to the {place} for {verb}.

One day, it met a {color} {animal} who loved {food}.
They became best friends and spent {number} hours {verb} together!

Everyone in the {place} thought this was very unusual,
but the {noun} and the {animal} didn't care.
They were having too much fun!

THE END
"""

print(story)
